subject: PEL: Update system info into HB PEL extended user data section
commitMessage:
PEL: Update system info into HB PEL extended user data section

Hostboot requested BMC add a UserData section containing debug
information like internal code level name and the bmc/host/chassis
states that are added to the BMC PELs. To accomodate this BMC code will
look in incoming PELs for an ED section with specific
compID/version/subtype fields, and then modify it with the appropriate
debug contents as mentioned above.

Test: Verified PEL tool output by injecting error to generate
hostboot PEL

Signed-off-by: Sumit Kumar <sumit_kumar@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I72288089f2768412eb9033b121e7f02f72f11fc7

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 3160a544ed041d5a2f7617e1d1deb8533fbf8059 by Matt Spinler

The only reason additionaData is being passed in here is to check if the PID of the process that creates the PEL is passed in, but that will never be the case for PELs that come from hostboot.

So I think you don't need to pass additionalData all the way in from the top, instead you can just make it a local variable here, and it will be empty.  that will also saving from changing the other function signatures.

While you're at it, I think it would be good to slighly tweak the addProcessNameToJSON function to not print "Unknown" if the PID isn't passed in, because there's really no reason that needs to show up in hostboot PELs at all.
Yeah right additionaData was mainly to lookup for PID. Will do the changes needed.

you'll need to modify _data, because only _data gets written to a file when the PEL is flattened.

Also, I think the function that sets _data will need to check that it doesn't grow its current size, because hostboot may already have a PEL at the max size so we don't want to bump out one of their sections.  It should be OK to shrink it.

yeah right _data to be updated.
I'll have another function created that would check the data size and update accordingly.
extra space
Done
That's right. Really no need for mData as we can do all within one function.

Shrink function is working now with minor modification "<="
115 bool ExtendedUserData::shrink(size_t newSize)
116 {
117     // minimum size is 8B header + 4B of fields + 4B of data
118     if ((newSize <= flattenedSize()) &&
119         (newSize >= (Section::flattenedSize() + 8)))
Can you add more of a description into the commit message?  We try to avoid 1 line commit messages.
Ok will do
this may increase the size though over newSize. For example size 30 would go to 32, and then the final size would be greater than newSize. I think it needs to be left how it is.

Yes the size may go up but it would still be within valid range. Is it ok otherwise to get the final size truncated? 
Max size is 200 bytes and it would enter this part of code only when the new size is "less than or equal to 200 bytes" so even if the newSize is ..197,198 or 199 it would still end up at 200 bytes max only and not beyond that.

if newSize were 199, then dataSize would first be 199 - 8 - 4 = 187, then 187 += 187%4 = 187 += 3 = 190.

so if data size is 190, then full section size is 190 + 8 + 4 = 202 which is too big.
This is in context of Data only part in ED section. Data size alone in section can be max 200 bytes. By default total size of section (including header) is 212 bytes max.
Incase I'm missing something here let me know and will go by original implementation
yea, I think you can just go back to what it was.  I'm hesitant about changing something that has had a lot of burn in time already.  Also, this is how the FSP did it.
ok fine.

while it would be safe to set the component ID inside of this function I think, I don't think it's safe to set the subType, because as this function just takes a vector of bytes there's no way to tell it's JSON.

I guess you could either pass in the subType as a function argument, or just set it directly from the PEL function after it calls this.  And for that matter, may as well do the same with componentID as you'll do with subType.
Ok will look into it.

I'm thinking you shouldn't actually need this, because here:

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/blob/master/extensions/openpower-pels/extended_user_data.cpp#L110

It is passing in the creatorID field from the ExtUserData section, which will be equal to OpenBMC in the case you care about.
yeah ok.
Done
looks good.  Could you add the doxygen for the new params here?
oh yeah will do
oh, sorry I missed this before, but C style casts are frowned upon.  Could you change this quick to static_cast?  Then it should be good to go.
Fixed in latest patch, looks cleaner this way.
